title: Windows 10 vs windows 8.1 League of Legends Ping/LAg
body:
Hello everyone, 
I was wondering how windows 10 is for you guys with league. It seems to me that even if i lower the graphics to very low, I lag and the ping starts to ryze tremendously. If any of yu have a solution, that would be great. NOTE: Ive tried everything there is on youtube that can maybe help  me.

replies.body:
*Karn Bishop* touched on some great points. Issues that occur with latency (ping) are generally caused by something on your local network or along your route that causes your connection to take a longer route to the server. Working through our [connection guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) would be my strongest recommendation since this guide often resolves these issues.

Let me know if this helped.
thanks! also,  can you re roll a champion permanent with 2 other champion shards?
Yup, you can. A shard is a shard in the eyes of Hextech Crafting.

The operating system should not really matter for stuff like ping, lag maybe however riot has optimized that for windows 10 already so thats not really an issue.

Ping is basically how long it takes for the game packets to jump from your PC > riots servers > your pc again, the higher the number the more noticeable the in game delay, generally this is an ISP issue though a rioter could be of help if that is the case.
